chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kamauri L Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession Of A Firearm By Adjudicated Delinquent, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(bm).
  • Operating Vehicle Without Owner's Consent (Knowing Passenger), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sets resitution at $600.00 payable to victim J.B.  Joint and several with coactors when charged.  Restitution to be paid before costs.

Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments including the DNA surcharges.  To be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC.  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment (AS TO ALL COUNTS).

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence and concurrent with count 3.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time work or school or combination of both.
Not to reside or be present where guns are present in any vehicle.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Operating Vehicle Without Owner's Consent (Knowing Passenger)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamauri L Green

records.addlTxt: Count one corrected per clerical error.

Defendant Kamauri L Green in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Kamauri L Green in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 YEARS 6 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence and concurrent to count 3. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS. 

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence and concurrent to count 1. 


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Not to reside or be present where guns are present in any  vehicle.

- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment (as to all counts). 


*Court sets restitution at $600.00 payable to victim J.B. and joint and several with co-actors when charged. Restitution to be paid before costs.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program AFTER SERVING 1 YEAR.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, 
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Kamauri L Green in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Kamauri L Green in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 and 3  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 and 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Defense requests to appear via zoom for sentencing hearing. Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding right to in person hearing. Court find defendant waives right to in person hearing.

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have a resolution and are requesting a plea hearing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 04.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE HANRAHAN.  Parties contacted regarding status conference on 5-27-2022. Court will be unable to hear at the time. Court rescheduled to 5-24-2022 10:30 am. Parties notified.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Kamauri L Green not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE HANRAHAN. Defense requests additional time for review of case. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.

Defendant Kamauri L Green in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Kamauri L Green in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 4.

Defendant Kamauri L Green in court by video, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Jodie B., Tyveria C., Deonta R., and Travon S-H.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kamauri L Green in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Kamauri L Green in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
